snippet: The arrival of Ramadan, Islam’s holiest month, has led to a variety of issues for the estimated 3,000 Muslim athletes and officials at the Olympic Games.
abstract: Arrival of Ramadan, Islam’s holiest month, has led to a variety of issues for the estimated 3,000 Muslim athletes and officials at the 2012 Olympics; questions still linger about how athletes should deal with training, competing and fasting.
lead_paragraph: The arrival of Ramadan, Islam’s holiest month, has led to a variety of issues for the estimated 3,000 Muslim athletes and officials at the Olympic Games.

headline.seo: Ramadan Poses Challenges for Muslims at the Olympics
headline.main: Observance of Ramadan Poses Challenges to Muslim Athletes
headline.print_headline: Observance of Ramadan Poses Challenges to Muslim Athletes
